comment.author: 91829349@N00
comment._content: There was an Albert Traeger of the "People's Progressive Party" who was a senior official in the Reichstag, but he died in 1932. Looks like a professional photographer embossing at lower right, so who knows how old this photo is. Don't know why he'd be in the news in 1914, though. www.worldlingo.com/ma/dewiki/en/Albert_Traeger

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: @rjones0856, I think you meant to say that he died in 1912 -- not 1932. The NYT reported his death on March 27, 1912. query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9E04E1D8143CE633A...

comment.author: 91829349@N00
comment._content: Oops -- yeah, 1912 it was.  Guess they were still talking about him in 1914...

comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: I started an entry for Wikipedia: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Albert_Traeger
